connector.description: Expose SOAP WebServices using Apache CXF or connect to external WebServices using CXF WS client.

camel.sink.path.beanId.name: camel.sink.path.beanId
camel.sink.path.beanId.description: To lookup an existing configured CxfEndpoint. Must used bean: as prefix.

camel.sink.endpoint.dataFormat.name: camel.sink.endpoint.dataFormat
camel.sink.endpoint.dataFormat.description: The data type messages supported by the CXF endpoint. One of: [PAYLOAD] [RAW] [MESSAGE] [CXF_MESSAGE] [POJO]

camel.sink.endpoint.wrappedStyle.name: camel.sink.endpoint.wrappedStyle
camel.sink.endpoint.wrappedStyle.description: The WSDL style that describes how parameters are represented in the SOAP body. If the value is false, CXF will chose the document-literal unwrapped style, If the value is true, CXF will chose the document-literal wrapped style

camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler
camel.sink.endpoint.cookieHandler.description: Configure a cookie handler to maintain a HTTP session

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperationName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperationName
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperationName.description: This option will set the default operationName that will be used by the CxfProducer which invokes the remote service.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperationName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperationNamespace
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperationName.description: This option will set the default operationNamespace that will be used by the CxfProducer which invokes the remote service.

camel.sink.endpoint.hostnameVerifier.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hostnameVerifier
camel.sink.endpoint.hostnameVerifier.description: The hostname verifier to be used. Use the # notation to reference a HostnameVerifier from the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.description: The Camel SSL setting reference. Use the # notation to reference the SSL Context.

camel.sink.endpoint.wrapped.name: camel.sink.endpoint.wrapped
camel.sink.endpoint.wrapped.description: Which kind of operation that CXF endpoint producer will invoke

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used

camel.sink.endpoint.allowStreaming.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowStreaming
camel.sink.endpoint.allowStreaming.description: This option controls whether the CXF component, when running in PAYLOAD mode, will DOM parse the incoming messages into DOM Elements or keep the payload as a javax.xml.transform.Source object that would allow streaming in some cases.

camel.sink.endpoint.bus.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bus
camel.sink.endpoint.bus.description: To use a custom configured CXF Bus.

camel.sink.endpoint.continuationTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.continuationTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.continuationTimeout.description: This option is used to set the CXF continuation timeout which could be used in CxfConsumer by default when the CXF server is using Jetty or Servlet transport.

camel.sink.endpoint.cxfBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cxfBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.cxfBinding.description: To use a custom CxfBinding to control the binding between Camel Message and CXF Message.

camel.sink.endpoint.cxfConfigurer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cxfConfigurer
camel.sink.endpoint.cxfConfigurer.description: This option could apply the implementation of org.apache.camel.component.cxf.CxfEndpointConfigurer which supports to configure the CXF endpoint in programmatic way. User can configure the CXF server and client by implementing configure{ServerClient} method of CxfEndpointConfigurer.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultBus.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultBus
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultBus.description: Will set the default bus when CXF endpoint create a bus by itself

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.sink.endpoint.mergeProtocolHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mergeProtocolHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.mergeProtocolHeaders.description: Whether to merge protocol headers. If enabled then propagating headers between Camel and CXF becomes more consistent and similar. For more details see CAMEL-6393.

camel.sink.endpoint.mtomEnabled.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mtomEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.mtomEnabled.description: To enable MTOM (attachments). This requires to use POJO or PAYLOAD data format mode.

camel.sink.endpoint.properties.name: camel.sink.endpoint.properties
camel.sink.endpoint.properties.description: To set additional CXF options using the key/value pairs from the Map. For example to turn on stacktraces in SOAP faults, properties.faultStackTraceEnabled=true

camel.sink.endpoint.skipPayloadMessagePa.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipPayloadMessagePartCheck
camel.sink.endpoint.skipPayloadMessagePa.description: Sets whether SOAP message validation should be disabled.

camel.sink.endpoint.loggingFeatureEnable.name: camel.sink.endpoint.loggingFeatureEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.loggingFeatureEnable.description: This option enables CXF Logging Feature which writes inbound and outbound SOAP messages to log.

camel.sink.endpoint.loggingSizeLimit.name: camel.sink.endpoint.loggingSizeLimit
camel.sink.endpoint.loggingSizeLimit.description: To limit the total size of number of bytes the logger will output when logging feature has been enabled and -1 for no limit.

camel.sink.endpoint.skipFaultLogging.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipFaultLogging
camel.sink.endpoint.skipFaultLogging.description: This option controls whether the PhaseInterceptorChain skips logging the Fault that it catches.

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: This option is used to set the basic authentication information of password for the CXF client.

camel.sink.endpoint.username.name: camel.sink.endpoint.username
camel.sink.endpoint.username.description: This option is used to set the basic authentication information of username for the CXF client.

camel.sink.endpoint.bindingId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bindingId
camel.sink.endpoint.bindingId.description: The bindingId for the service model to use.

camel.sink.endpoint.portName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.portName
camel.sink.endpoint.portName.description: The endpoint name this service is implementing, it maps to the wsdl:portname. In the format of ns:PORT_NAME where ns is a namespace prefix valid at this scope.

camel.sink.endpoint.publishedEndpointUrl.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publishedEndpointUrl
camel.sink.endpoint.publishedEndpointUrl.description: This option can override the endpointUrl that published from the WSDL which can be accessed with service address url plus wsd

camel.sink.endpoint.serviceClass.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serviceClass
camel.sink.endpoint.serviceClass.description: The class name of the SEI (Service Endpoint Interface) class which could have JSR181 annotation or not.

camel.sink.endpoint.serviceName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serviceName
camel.sink.endpoint.serviceName.description: The service name this service is implementing, it maps to the wsdl:servicename.

camel.sink.endpoint.wsdlURL.name: camel.sink.endpoint.wsdlURL
camel.sink.endpoint.wsdlURL.description: The location of the WSDL. Can be on the classpath, file system, or be hosted remotely.

camel.component.cxf.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.cxf.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.cxf.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.cxf.allowStreaming.name: camel.component.cxf.allowStreaming
camel.component.cxf.allowStreaming.description: This option controls whether the CXF component, when running in PAYLOAD mode, will DOM parse the incoming messages into DOM Elements or keep the payload as a javax.xml.transform.Source object that would allow streaming in some cases.

camel.component.cxf.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.cxf.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.cxf.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.cxf.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.component.cxf.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.cxf.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.cxf.useGlobalSslContextP.name: camel.component.cxf.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.cxf.useGlobalSslContextP.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
